titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّهُ لَوْ لَمْ يَبْقَ فِي الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا رَجُلَانِ لَكَانَ أَحَدُهُمَا الْحُجَّةَ
titles.en: Chapter 6 – If it was that there did not remain in the earth except for two men, one of the two would be the Divine Aurhority

titles.ar: بَابُ مَعْرِفَةِ الْإِمَامِ وَ الرَّدِّ إِلَيْهِ
titles.en: Chapter 7 – Recognition of the Imam<sup>asws</sup> and the referring (of the matters) to him<sup>asws</sup>

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ الْأَرْضَ لَا تَخْلُو مِنْ حُجَّةٍ
titles.en: Chapter 5 – The earth cannot be empty from a Divine Authority

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّهُ لَوْ لَمْ يَبْقَ فِي الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا رَجُلَانِ لَكَانَ أَحَدُهُمَا الْحُجَّةَ
titles.en: Chapter 6 – If it was that there did not remain in the earth except for two men, one of the two would be the Divine Aurhority

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (298/ 2)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنِ ابْنِ الطَّيَّارِ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ لَوْ لَمْ يَبْقَ فِي الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا اثْنَانِ لَكَانَ أَحَدُهُمَا الْحُجَّةَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Ibn Al Tayyar who said,
‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘If there do not remain in the earth except for two, one of the two would be the Divine Authority’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn Sinan from ibn al-Tayyar who has said the following. “I heard abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) saying, ‘Would there remain no one on earth except two persons one of them would certainly be the person with Divine authority.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف بسندي ه - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (299/ 2)

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ إِدْرِيسَ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى جَمِيعاً عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى بْنِ عُبَيْدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ حَمْزَةَ بْنِ الطَّيَّارِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَوْ بَقِيَ اثْنَانِ لَكَانَ أَحَدُهُمَا الْحُجَّةَ عَلَى صَاحِبِهِ .
مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى مِثْلَهُ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Idrees and Muhammad Bin Yahya altogether, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Isa Bin Ubeyd, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Hamza Bin Al Tayyar,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘If two remain, it would be so that one of the two would be the Divine Authority upon his companion’.
Muhammad Bin Al Hassan, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhammad Bin Isa – similar to it.
en.sarwar: 2. Ahmad ibn Idris and Muhammad ibn Yahya together have narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from abu ‘Ubayd from Muhammad ibn Sinan from abu Hamza ibn al-Tayyar from abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) who has said the following. “Would there remain only two people on earth, one of them would the person with divine authority over the other.” Muhammad ibn al-Hassan has narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa a similar Hadith.

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (299/ 2)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ مُوسَى الْخَشَّابِ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ كَرَّامٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) لَوْ كَانَ النَّاسُ رَجُلَيْنِ لَكَانَ أَحَدُهُمَا الْإِمَامَ
وَ قَالَ إِنَّ آخِرَ مَنْ يَمُوتُ الْإِمَامُ لِئَلَّا يَحْتَجَّ أَحَدٌ عَلَى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَنَّهُ تَرَكَهُ بِغَيْرِ حُجَّةٍ لِلَّهِ عَلَيْهِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from the one who mentioned it, from Al Hassan Bin Musa Al Khashhab, from Ja’far Bin Muhammad, from Karram who said,
‘Abu Abdllah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘If the people were (only) two men, it would be so that one of the two would be the Imam<sup>asws</sup>’.

And he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The last one to be dying would be the Imam<sup>asws</sup>, lest anyone could argue against Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic that He<sup>azwj</sup> Left him to be without a Divine Authority of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> upon him’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from those who he has mentioned from al-Hassan ibn Musa al-Khashshab from Ja’far ibn Muhammad from Kiram from abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) who has said the following. “If of all the people there will remain only two man one of them will be the Imam. He also said, ‘The last person to die will be the Imam (a.s.) so that no one could complain against Allah leaving him without Imam, the person with Divine authority over him.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/299)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الْبَرْقِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ ابْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ حَمْزَةَ بْنِ الطَّيَّارِ قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ لَوْ لَمْ يَبْقَ فِي الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا اثْنَانِ لَكَانَ أَحَدُهُمَا الْحُجَّةَ أَوْ الثَّانِي الْحُجَّةَ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Al Barqy, from Ali Bin Ismail, from Ibn Sinan, from Hamza Bin Al Tayyar who said,

‘I heard Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘If there do not remain in the earth except for two, it would be so that one of the two would be the Divine Authority’, or (he<sup>asws</sup> said): ‘The second one would be the Divine Authority’.
The doubt is from Ahmad Bin Muhammad (the fourth narrator).
en.sarwar: 4. A number of our people has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad al-Barqi from Ali ibn Isma‘il from ibn Sinan from Hamza ibn al-Tayyar who has said the following. “I heard Imam abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) saying, ‘Would there remain on earth no one except two people one of them will be the person with Divine authority or the second one will be the person with Divine authority (uncertainty is from the narrator).”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/299)

narrator_chain.text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ عَنِ النَّهْدِيِّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: سَمِعْتُهُ يَقُولُ لَوْ لَمْ يَكُنْ فِي الْأَرْضِ إِلَّا اثْنَانِ لَكَانَ الْإِمَامُ أَحَدَهُمَا .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Al Hassan, from Al Nahdy, from his father, from Yunus Bin Yaqoub,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I heard him<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘If it was so that there do not happen to be in the earth except for two, it would be so that the Imam<sup>asws</sup> would be one of the two’.
en.sarwar: Ahmad ibn Muhammad has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Hassan from al-Nahdi from his father from Yunus ibn ya‘qub from abu ‘Abdallah who has said the following. “Would there remain no one except two people one of them will certainly be the Imam.”
